name: Seat Light Control
about: Transforming a street light control box into a bench

name: LightWell
about: Solar-powered public seat and planter that visualizes Boston's stormwater systems through LED lights connected to real-time groundwater sensors
authors: Michelle Laboy, Joshua Fiedler, Seth Wiseman

name: LightWell v2*
about: Building off of the original LightWell project, this is a citizen science project using sensor-connected well caps and a mobile app to continuously collect and visualize groundwater data citywide
authors: Michelle Laboy, Joshua Fiedler, Seth Wiseman, Boston Groundwater Trust

name: Tidraphone
about: Interactive tidal vibraphone installed on Congress Street Bridge that plays different melodies based on tide levels, using sound to engage the public with climate change and sea level rise
authors: Kate Balug, Dana Busch, Alyson Fletcher, Emily Goldsmith, Conor MacDonald, Joseph Wight, Noah Vawter

name: Stairs of Fabulousness
about: Temporary rainbow staircase installation at Boston City Hall using fluorescent grit tape to improve safety, visibility, and fabulousness

name: Portable Reading Room
about: Mobile library on the Rose Kennedy Greenway
authors: Leslie Davol, Sam Davol, Höweler + Yoon Architecture, Diana Limbach Lempel

name: Franklin St. Neighborway
location: Allston, Franklin St. and Fern St.
about: Street Mural on Franklin St. in Allston
authors: Mark Chase, Michelle Moon, Ross Miller, Jessica Robertson, Galen Mook, Emma Walters, Harry Mattison, John Powell, Lea Beaulieu, Paola Ferrer, Tim McHale

name: Night Garden
about: Activating Boston's community gardens with outdoor light installations for evening gatherings and artistic expression, extending garden hours

name: Public Stage
about: Installation of a sound system at Symphony Community Park to stream live performances from the Boston Symphony Orchestra  with synchronized light displays during summer and fall evenings.
authors: Liat Racin, Matan Mayer, Mariko Davidson, Christiana Usenza, Alon Dagan

name: Public Radio
about: Giant radio for all at District Hall
authors: New American Public Art (Dan Sternof Beyer, Greg MacGlashing, Bevan Weissman) and Andrew Ringler

Mattapan
about: Poem and Photography series in the windows of the Mattapan Branch Library

name: Kit of Parks
about: Portable kit of parts to build a park that unpacks in under five minutes to activate underutilized public spaces

name: Radiant Forest
about: Translucent colored screens on a bus shelter creating a dappled forest canopy effect that filters light and evolves throughout the day and seasons
authors: Sasaki (Ryan Collier, Chris Freda, Anthony Lawson, Jhanéa Williams)

name: Mystery Map
about: Sidewalk mural as a puzzle in East Boston

name: Ecosonic Playground
about: Musical installation featuring instruments inspired by Vietnamese folk traditions installed near corner school bus stops

name: Play and Yay!
about: 520-square-foot painted sidewalk installation at the Trotter School designed as a large-scale coloring book where visitors add chalk designs and follow interconnected paths
authors: Lisa Jeanne Graf, Mayor's Mural Crew

name: Words on the Street
about: Three spinning prize wheels with bilingual words that combine to create phrases for creative play and language learning in Roslindale

name: Cross Pollination
